meanings.definition: A chemical compound used in the production of dyes.
meanings.sent1: The tolidine added color to the dye mixture.
meanings.sent2: The factory used tolidine to create vibrant dyes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous scientist accidentally spilled tolidine on his white lab coat, turning it into a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was a canvas of emotions, with tolidine representing the depth of her sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The tolidine transformed the plain fabric into a masterpiece of hues.

meanings.sent1: The tolidine compound was a variation of aniline.
meanings.sent2: Chemists often study the properties of tolidine and aniline.
meanings.sent3: The tolidine molecule and the aniline molecule walked into a bar, sparking a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent4: In the world of chemistry, tolidine is like the cousin of aniline, sharing similar traits.
meanings.sent5: The tolidine derivative exhibited unique characteristics under the microscope.

meanings.sent1: Organic chemistry class discussed the properties of tolidine as an organic compound.
meanings.sent2: The tolidine structure was a key topic in the organic chemistry lecture.
meanings.sent3: The tolidine compound was the star of the show in the organic chemistry lab experiment.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of organic compounds, tolidine stood out with its distinct features.
meanings.sent5: The tolidine organic compound displayed fascinating reactions in the experiment.
